noun.description: A long-bladed hand tool with a beveled cutting edge and a plain handle that is struck with a hammer or mallet, used to cut or shape wood, stone, metal, or other hard materials.

verb.description: Cut or shape (something) with a chisel.
examples: carefully chisel out a groove for the hinge

verb.description: Cheat or swindle (someone) out of something.
examples: he's chiseled me out of my dues

origin: Late Middle English: from Old Northern French, based on Latin cis- (as in late Latin cisorium), variant of caes-, stem of caedere to cut. Compare with scissors.
